Hi, 

I've been encountering an annoying unity crash when playing. It's not easily reproduced (unfortunately), seems to happen more often in the VAB than anywhere else, but it also occurs in flight - so far never in the tracking station or any other scenes. 

With high part / large craft it occurs more often, but it also occurs if I play KSP for more than a couple of hours at a time without restarting it. Unfortunately the KSP log file is not helpful when this occurs - it simply outputs the last "in game" event and then nothing. It's a Unity crash (the Unity window pops up and it's trying to generate a crash report), so I'm not convinced that it's something in the mods I'm using. I've put the Player-prev.log (from C:\Users\<name>\AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program) above in a spoiler that shows everything after the crash occurs.

This is outside of my technical comfort zone, can anyone offer any assistance please?

From your

4 minutes ago, Kielm said:

With high part / large craft it occurs more often

 

4 minutes ago, Kielm said:

if I play KSP for more than a couple of hours

this smells like a memory issue. I suggest you check the memory consumption and the available memory.

Just now, VoidSquid said:

From your

 

this smells like a memory issue. I suggest you check the memory consumption and the available memory.

Thanks for the reply. 

I don't use that many mods (mostly the USI suite plus a few quality of life bits), and have 32Gb so I don't think it's that, but I can understand why you would think it might be.
If you have a crash dump, I could put it through a debugger, often it points to the culprit.
I can check - where might I find that?
Usually \AppData\Local\CrashDumps or \AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\Crashes

Thanks. 

Oddly enough there are only 2x KSP crash dumps in there which indicates it's not catching all of them, or this was a separate crash, as the last occurance was 7 days ago. Can't guarantee this will be the correct issue but here it is.

That was easy:

Spoiler

FAILURE_MODULE_NAME:  gameoverlayrenderer64

gameoverlayrenderer64.dll is from Valve Corporation and is part of Steam Game Overlay.

It is well known that such software can cause KSP game crashes.

@VoidSquid I have just had another crash and let Unity gather it's crash report. 

Can I ask what debugger you're using?

WinDbg x64

You can get it here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-hardware/drivers/debugger/debugger-download-tools

Configure the symbol path to something like

srv*c:\symbols*https://msdl.microsoft.com/download/symbols

and you're good to go!

26 minutes ago, VoidSquid said:

WinDbg x64

Thanks. This looks like a very generic memory violation error to me, are you able to advise anything more detailed?

Link to dump

That's where the job-experience part comes in.  

0xc0000005 or "general protection fault" is most often caused by drivers, that's my first look then.

*******************************************************************************
*                                                                             *
*                        Exception Analysis                                   *
*                                                                             *
*******************************************************************************

*** WARNING: Unable to verify timestamp for mono-2.0-bdwgc.dll
*** WARNING: Unable to verify timestamp for nvwgf2umx.dll

Two DLLs listed here, one is from KSP, one from the Nvidia graphics driver.
I'm assuming (and most of the time you can) it's not caused by any Windows DLL, these two are most probably involved in that GPF.

The instruction at 0x%08lx referenced memory at 0x%08lx. The memory could not be %s.

Again, very typical for driver issue. Now what is causing this?

The fault address in not in any loaded module, please check your build's rebase

As I thought, the debugger doesn't know the module, it is most probably not a problem caused by Windows itself, we told the bugger where to download any Windows related stuff from:

38 minutes ago, VoidSquid said:

srv*c:\symbols*https://msdl.microsoft.com/download/symbols

C:\symbols is the local cache, for everything not cached go to msdl.microsoft.com

FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_UnityPlayer.dll!Unknown

This is it, the crash is caused by Unity, i.e.  KSP itself. Which usually doesn't behave like this . Something made Unity crashing, and by experience, it's some mod, probably having issues with either the current Unity version, or another mod. 

Best guess: an outdated mod.

Second guess (as we know the graphics driver might be involved): outdated graphics driver. Or something else interfering with graphics, like that Steam Overlay.

 

So that's my preliminary analysis here.

Very detailed analysis, thanks. 

My drivers are up to date, and I'm using some outdated mods, so I suspect it'll be mod related. 

Unfortunately as many mods haven't ported to 1.11 the list of potential culprits is quite extensive, so it looks like I'll have to put up with it until I can't put up with it anymore, or start yanking stuff out in the middle of a career game. I'll have a look over what I've got and yank as much as I reasonably can. 

 

Thanks again, you're a star.

15 minutes ago, Kielm said:

Thanks again, you're a star.

Blushing... nah, just someone who tries to help here and there a bit.

16 minutes ago, Kielm said:

My drivers are up to date

I do remember a graphics bug in Hitman 2 that was caused by newer drivers, older drivers did work fine though. Meaning: latest, most of the time, is fine, but just not always.  

17 minutes ago, Kielm said:

Unfortunately as many mods haven't ported to 1.11 the list of potential culprits is quite extensive

You're familiar with the old principle of bisection to find a solution? Remove half of your mods. If the issue persists, it must be one of the not removed mods, if it is gone, must be one of the removed mods. Rinse and repeat, and you'll find the culprit in short time.

 

Now, that said, I think currently I'm only one here doing crash dump debugging. And you seem to be interested in that too. Maybe you could  help other folks too with debugging their crash dumps? Just saying...

45 minutes ago, VoidSquid said:

I do remember a graphics bug in Hitman 2 that was caused by newer drivers, older drivers did work fine though. Meaning: latest, most of the time, is fine, but just not always.

I won't rule out graphics - one crash has occurred in the VAB and was preceded by black flickering textures. Another in the VAB but without the flickering. Then again, many of the crashes have been in flight scenes and have occurred suddenly. I couldn't even say for certain if it was still happening in the previous driver, but I suspect it was. 

45 minutes ago, VoidSquid said:

You're familiar with the old principle of bisection to find a solution? Remove half of your mods. If the issue persists, it must be one of the not removed mods, if it is gone, must be one of the removed mods. Rinse and repeat, and you'll find the culprit in short time.

Unfortunately it's the timescales between crashes that make it difficult. It can be anything from 2-4 hours between crashes occurring so that's that's 16 hours worth of testing to narrow it down to 3 mods - assuming the crash occurs within the typical timescales.
